contentrichtext.text: {{Coord|34.643077|109.236267|type:landmark_scale:15000|display=title}} {{Primarysources|date=November 2007}} {{Infobox company | name = Avic Xi'an Aircraft Industry (Group) Company Ltd. | logo = [[File:Avic Xi-an logo.gif|300px]] | caption = | type = [[Government-owned corporation]] | traded_as = | genre = | fate = | predecessor = | successor = | foundation = 1958 ([[Xi'an]]) | founder = | defunct = | location_city = [[Xi'an]], [[Shaanxi]] | location_country = [[China]] | location = | locations = | area_served = Worldwide | key_people = | industry = [[Aerospace industry|Aerospace]] | products = [[Aircraft]] | services = | revenue = | operating_income = | net_income = | aum = | assets = | equity = | owner = | num_employees = Approx. 20,000 | parent = | divisions = | subsid = [[Xi'an Aircraft International Corporation]] | homepage = {{URL|http://www.xac.com.cn/}} | footnotes = }} '''Xi'an Aircraft Industrial Corporation''' ({{zh|s=西安飞机工业|t=西安飛機工業|p=Xī'ān fēijī gōngyè}}), also known as '''Xi'an Aircraft Company Limited''' (XAC), is a [[China|Chinese]] aircraft manufacturer and developer of large and medium-sized airplanes. It is based in [[Yanliang]] District, [[Xi'an]], [[Shaanxi]] Province. It is joint partners with [[603rd Aircraft Design Institute]] of military aircraft. XAC was established in 1958 and has more than 20,000 employees. Its key clients include the [[People's Liberation Army Naval Air Force]] and [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]]. Currently, it is a [[subsidiary]] of [[AVIC I]]. Its subsidiary and [[listed company]] is [[Xi'an Aircraft International Corporation]] ({{szse2|000768}}). 　 ==Products== ===Turboprops=== * [[Xian MA60]] turbo-prop airliner * [[Xian MA600]] turbo-prop airliner * [[Xian MA700]] turbo-prop airliner (development) ===Bombers=== * [[Xian H-8]] strategic, heavy bomber (cancelled) * [[Xian JH-7|Xian JH-7 Flying Leopard]] twin engine fighter-bomber. NATO codename "Flounder" * [[Xian H-6]] twin engine bomber - Chinese-upgraded variant of the [[Tupolev Tu-16]] Badger ===Trainers=== * [[Xian Y-7|Y-7H]] trainer based on Y-7-100 ===Parts=== * [[ACAC ARJ21|ACAC ARJ21 Xiangfeng]] -wings and fuselage ===Transport=== * [[Xian Y-7|Yun-7 (Y-7)]] twin-engine turboprop transport * [[Antonov An-26|Yun-14 (Y-14)]] twin-engine turboprop transport * [[Xian Y-20]] four-engine turbofan transport<ref>[http://www.flightglobal.com/blogs/the-dewline/2009/12/c-17-and-a400m-had-a-baby-in-c.html C-17 and A400M had a baby ... in China]</ref><ref>[http://defense-studies.blogspot.com/2013/01/chinas-new-freight-plane-extends.html China’s New Freight Plane Extends Military Modernization Program]</ref> ==See also== * [[People's Liberation Army Air Force]] ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== {{commonscat|Xian Aircraft Industrial Corporation}} * [http://www.xac.com.cn/ Official Xi'an Aircraft Industrial Corporation website] {{zh icon}} * [http://www.xac.com.cn/Corporation/infoDetail6.asp?cInfoId=184&dInfoId=161 English introduction in its official website] {{Transportation in the People's Republic of China}} {{Aircraft manufacturers of China}} [[Category:Aircraft manufacturers of China]] [[Category:Government-owned companies of China]] [[Category:Defence companies of the People's Republic of China]] [[Category:Companies based in Shaanxi]] [[Category:Companies established in 1958]] [[Category:1958 establishments in China]]
